com.sri.ai.grinder.sgdpllt.core.constraint

Class AbstractTheory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.sgdpllt.core.constraint.AbstractTheory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Theory, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTheoryWithBinaryAtoms, AbstractTranslationBasedTheory, CompoundTheory, PropositionalTheory

    @Beta
public abstract class AbstractTheory
extends Object
implements Theory

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractTheory()
      Initializes types for testing to be the collection of a single type, a Categorical Type named SomeType with domain size 5 and known constants a, b, c, d, variables for testing to X, Y, Z of type SomeType, of which X is the main testing variable on which testing literals are generated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Theory clone() 
      TopRewriter getDefaultTopRewriter()
      Get (possibly cached) default top rewriter.
      Collection<Type> getNativeTypes()
      Provides types that must be present in the context while using theory, even if no variables are associated with them.
      Rewriter getRewriter()
      Returns a cached version of a recursive exhaustive rewriter based on Theory.getTopRewriter().
      TopRewriter getTopRewriter()
      Returns a TopRewriter performing the same simplification as Theory.simplify(Expression, Context), but only on the top expression (that is, without recursing to sub-expressions).
      TopRewriter makeDefaultTopRewriter()
      A TopRewriter combining basic simplifications and quantifier elimination rewriters.
      ExpressionLiteralSplitterStepSolver makeEvaluatorStepSolver(Expression expression)
      Provides an evaluator step solver that must be based on a recursive exhaustive application of Theory.getTopRewriter() and also externalize literals (this ensures completeness in the sense that, if the resulting value is the same under all contexts, which will be detected and that single value will be returned, because if then Value else if then Value else Value gets simplified to Value).
      TopRewriter makeSymbolicQuantifierEliminationRewriters() 
      Expression simplify(Expression expression, Context context)
      A method simplifying an expression according to this theory.
      String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        public AbstractTheory()
        Initializes types for testing to be the collection of a single type, a Categorical Type named SomeType with domain size 5 and known constants a, b, c, d, variables for testing to X, Y, Z of type SomeType, of which X is the main testing variable on which testing literals are generated.

      • simplify

        public Expression simplify(Expression expression,
                           Context context)
        Description copied from interface: Theory
        A method simplifying an expression according to this theory. It must at a minimum replace expressions by their values, if their values are defined by some of their arguments (such as X + 0 being equal to X.
        Specified by:
        simplify in interface Theory
        Returns:

      • makeEvaluatorStepSolver

        public ExpressionLiteralSplitterStepSolver makeEvaluatorStepSolver(Expression expression)
        Description copied from interface: Theory
        Provides an evaluator step solver that must be based on a recursive exhaustive application of Theory.getTopRewriter() and also externalize literals (this ensures completeness in the sense that, if the resulting value is the same under all contexts, which will be detected and that single value will be returned, because if then Value else if then Value else Value gets simplified to Value).
        Specified by:
        makeEvaluatorStepSolver in interface Theory
        Returns:

      • getNativeTypes

        public Collection<Type> getNativeTypes()
        Description copied from interface: Theory
        Provides types that must be present in the context while using theory, even if no variables are associated with them. Default implementation is no types; override for introducing them.
        Specified by:
        getNativeTypes in interface Theory
        Returns:
